com.kremerk.Sqlite
Class ColumnExpression

java.lang.Object
  com.kremerk.Sqlite.ColumnExpression

public class ColumnExpression
extends java.lang.Object

A expression to allow for custom columns and functions to be called as part of a "select" portion of a sql statment.

The idea here is to be able to return arbitrary columns and to operate on columns (such as SQLite's Date/Time Functions). This class is used in conjunction with SqlExecutor.getColumns(ColumnExpression) to return a list of maps. Each entry in the list is a map of the specified column/field name to it's value.

For example if my sql statement was returning something like:

nameage
John21
Mary31

A call to the resulting List<Map<String, Object>> that looked like list.get(1).get("name") would return "Mary".

Since this is used in conjunction with SqlExecutor/SqlStatement there still needs to be a POJO that "maps" to a database table. This just lets you get a non-Object from the database and perform functions on a column.

Constructor Detail

ColumnExpression

public ColumnExpression()
Method Detail

column

public ColumnExpression column(java.lang.String columnString)
Specify the column to limit you're resulting query by. A function (such as SQLite's Date/Time Functions) can be used in the passed in string too.

Parameters:
columnString - The column to query.
Returns:
A ColumnExpression for function chaining.

as

public ColumnExpression as(java.lang.String alias)
Lets you alias a column if you want. This can be useful when using a function in the column(String).

Parameters:
alias - The name of the alias for the column.
Returns:
A ColumnExpression for function chaining.

distinct

public ColumnExpression distinct()
Allows you to specify making a query distinc, which will eliminate duplicate rows in the result set.

Returns:
A ColumnExpression for function chaining.
